text: UzSWLU - Uzbekistan State World Languages University. The university was founded in 1992. It is located in Tashkent city. The university offers education in English, German, French, Russian, Chinese, Arabic, Japanese, Korean, Spanish, Italian, and Turkish languages. It is the only state higher education institution specialized in foreign languages in Uzbekistan.
title: About UzSWLU

text: UzSWLU Faculties: 1) Faculty of English Philology - English language teacher training, translation and linguistics. 2) Faculty of German Language - German language and literature. 3) Faculty of French Language - French language and literature. 4) Faculty of Russian Language - Russian language and literature. 5) Faculty of Oriental Languages - Arabic, Chinese, Japanese, Korean languages. 6) Faculty of Romance-Germanic Philology - Italian, Spanish languages. 7) Faculty of Translation Studies - professional interpreters and translators. 8) Faculty of International Journalism.
title: List of Faculties

text: UzSWLU Admission Process: Applicants take exams at the State Testing Center. Admission is based on grants (scholarships) and contracts (paid tuition). For English language programs, CEFR B2 level is required. For other languages, A2-B1 level is sufficient. Ranking is based on exam results. Grant places are limited - high scores are required. Admission period is June-August.
title: Admission Process

text: UzSWLU Tuition Fees: Annual payment is between 8-15 million soums (depending on the program). English language program is the most expensive - 12-15 million soums. Other languages cost 8-12 million soums. Scholarship: Grant-based students receive 500-800 thousand soums monthly. Additional scholarships available for excellent grades. Discounts available for talented students.
title: Tuition and Scholarships

text: UzSWLU Study Duration: Bachelor's degree - 4 years. Master's degree - 2 years. Distance learning is also available. Each semester has 18-20 weeks of classes. There are 2 semesters per year. Exams are held during sessions. Thesis defense is at the end of the 4th year. State-standard diploma is issued upon graduation.
title: Study Duration

text: UzSWLU Student Life: Dormitory is available (limited places). Modern library with up-to-date literature. Sports hall and fitness center available. Various clubs for students: debate club, language clubs, cultural events. International exchange programs available. Internships can be held abroad.
title: Student Life

text: UzSWLU Career Opportunities for Graduates: Teaching (schools, colleges, universities). Translation/Interpretation (companies, organizations). Tourism industry. Diplomacy and international relations. Opening foreign language courses. Working in import-export companies. High opportunities for working abroad.
title: Career Opportunities

text: UzSWLU Address and Contact Information: Address: Tashkent city, Gafur Gulom street, 21. Metro: Near Oybek station. Phone: +998712441314. Official website: uzswlu.uz. Admission committee: Active in June-August. Open doors day: Held in March-April.
title: Address and Contact

text: UzSWLU History: The university was founded in 1949 as the Tashkent Foreign Languages Pedagogical Institute. The university has over 70 years of history. In 1992, by Presidential Decree PF-401, the Tashkent Foreign Languages Pedagogical Institute and the Republican Russian Language and Literature Institute merged to become Uzbekistan State World Languages University.
title: University History

text: UzSWLU Statistics: Currently about 23,168 students study at the university. Students learn nearly 20 foreign languages based on world education standards. Every year, bachelor's degrees are prepared in 27 education directions, and master's degrees in 19 directions.
title: University Statistics

text: UzSWLU International Partnerships: The university cooperates with over 180 higher education institutions worldwide. Partners include universities from USA, Europe, Arab countries, Africa, and CIS countries. Top partner universities: Arizona University, Webster University, Purdue University (USA), Saint Petersburg State University, Moscow State Linguistic University, Kazan Federal University (Russia), Sorbonne University (France), Humboldt University, Heidelberg University (Germany), Peking Foreign Languages University, Shanghai Foreign Languages University (China).
title: International Partnerships

text: UzSWLU Joint Programs: In 2018, a one-year master's program was established with Webster University (USA). This master's program is unique in Central Asia. Currently, the university has joint education programs with Japan Digital University, Moscow State Linguistic University, and Adygea State University (Russia). Joint diploma programs with Chinese, Russian, and Turkish universities are being developed.
title: Joint Programs

text: UzSWLU Rector: Tuxtasinov Ilxomjon Madaminovich. Reception hours: Monday 15:00-17:00. Phone: +998712301291. Email: rector@uzswlu.uz
title: Rector Information

text: Faculty of English #1 at UzSWLU: Dean is Ergasheva Guli Ismoilovna, Doctor of Philological Sciences, Professor. The faculty has over 4,000 students. 118 professors and teachers work at the faculty, including 4 Doctors of Science and 14 PhDs. Departments include: English Functional Lexics, Applied English, English Teaching Methodology and Education Technologies, Theoretical English.
title: Faculty of English #1

text: Faculty of English #2 at UzSWLU: Dean is Kulmatov Baxrom Gulyamovich, PhD in Pedagogical Sciences. The faculty has 2,460 students in two programs: Foreign Language and Literature (English) and Foreign Language in Preschool and Primary Education (English). The faculty has 137 professors and teachers, including 6 Doctors of Science and 21 PhDs.
title: Faculty of English #2

text: Faculty of English Philology at UzSWLU: The faculty was established in 2019. Currently has over 4,000 students studying in day and evening formats. 118 professors and teachers work here, including 4 Doctors of Philological Sciences and 14 PhDs. Dean: Azzamov Yusufjon Radjaboyevich.
title: Faculty of English Philology

text: UzSWLU Awards and Rankings: The university is ranked in UI GreenMetric World University Rankings. UzSWLU is in the top 2 in Uzbekistan in 2 categories. The university was included in THE Impact Rankings.
title: Rankings

text: UzSWLU Exchange Programs: About 200 professors and teachers, and over 200 students (bachelor's, master's, doctoral) annually visit partner universities for study, advanced training courses, and international conferences. Students can participate in programs organized by KOICA, JICA, TIKA, US Embassy, and British Council.
title: Exchange Programs

text: Languages taught at UzSWLU: English, German, French, Russian, Chinese, Arabic, Japanese, Korean, Spanish, Italian, Turkish, and other languages. English is the most popular - there are 3 separate English faculties plus English Philology faculty. Oriental languages (Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Arabic) are taught at the Faculty of Oriental Languages.
title: Languages Offered

text: UzSWLU Research Centers: The university has the Republican Scientific-Practical Center for Development of Innovative Methods of Teaching Foreign Languages. This center is the leading institution for foreign language teaching in Central Asia.
title: Research Centers

text: UzSWLU Scholarships: Presidential Scholarship, Islom Karimov State Scholarship, Navoiy State Scholarship, Aleksandr Faynberg State Scholarship, Rector's Scholarship. Grant-based students receive monthly stipends of 500-800 thousand soums. Additional scholarships for excellent academic performance.
title: Scholarships

text: UzSWLU Working Hours: Monday to Saturday, 8:30 AM to 6:00 PM. Dean offices accept visitors Monday to Friday 8:30-18:00. Admission committee works June to August.
title: Working Hours

text: UzSWLU Language Requirements for Admission: English programs require CEFR B2 certificate (IELTS 5.5-6.0 or equivalent). German, French, Spanish programs require A2-B1 level. Chinese, Japanese, Korean programs accept beginners. Russian programs require basic knowledge.
title: Language Requirements

text: UzSWLU Bachelor Programs: Foreign Language and Literature (in English, German, French, Russian, Chinese, Arabic, Japanese, Korean, Spanish, Italian, Turkish), Translation Theory and Practice (in various languages), Foreign Language in Preschool and Primary Education, International Journalism. Total 27 bachelor programs.
title: Bachelor Programs

text: UzSWLU Master Programs: Linguistics (Romance-Germanic languages), Philology and Language Teaching, Translation Theory and Practice, Foreign Language Teaching Methodology. Total 19 master programs. Duration: 2 years.
title: Master Programs

text: UzSWLU Documents Required for Admission: Passport, School diploma/certificate, CEFR language certificate, Photos (3x4), Medical certificate, Application form. For grant competition - exam results from State Testing Center.
title: Required Documents

text: UzSWLU Campus Addresses: Main campus: Tashkent, Gafur Gulom street 21 (near Oybek metro). Additional campuses: Kichik halqa yo'li G9-A 21, Uchtepa district Zakovat-4, Chilonzor district Lutfiy-8, Chilonzor district Muqumiy-104.
title: Campus Locations

text: Faculty of Oriental Languages at UzSWLU teaches: Arabic language and literature, Chinese language and literature, Japanese language and literature, Korean language and literature. Students learn from native speakers and experienced local professors. Exchange programs available to China, Japan, Korea, and Arab countries.
title: Faculty of Oriental Languages

text: Faculty of Translation Studies at UzSWLU: Trains professional interpreters and translators in English, German, Korean, Japanese, and Chinese. Students learn both written and oral translation, consecutive and simultaneous interpretation. Graduates work in international organizations, embassies, and major companies.
title: Faculty of Translation

text: Faculty of International Journalism at UzSWLU: Prepares qualified journalists with foreign language skills. Students learn journalism, media production, and foreign languages simultaneously. Graduates work in international media, press services, and public relations.
title: Faculty of International Journalism
